# Pipes, Redirection, grep, awk, and sed

This chapter shows how to combine small commands with pipes and use basic `awk`/`sed` operations.

## Create a CSV and pipe through tools

```{bash}
# Make a small CSV
cat > sample.csv << 'CSV'
id,name,age
1,Alice,30
2,Bob,25
3,Charlie,35
CSV

# Count lines (including header)
wc -l sample.csv

# Print second column (names) using awk
awk -F',' 'NR>1 {print $2}' sample.csv

# Select rows where age > 30 using awk
awk -F',' 'NR==1 || $3>30' sample.csv

# Replace header name with sed (in-place demonstration using output redirection)
sed '1s/name,age,/name_years,age/' sample.csv > sample_fixed.csv
cat sample_fixed.csv
